summary: This is an email chain regarding a FOIA request from Bloomberg News to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. The request seeks the identity of a financial institution referred to as 'Institution-1' in a court filing related to the 2019 criminal case against Jeffrey Epstein. The email discusses setting up a call to address the request, which is believed to be exempt from disclosure.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (19-cr-00490) brought by the SDNY in July 2019. The FOIA request concerns assets controlled by him.

events.title: SDNY Criminal Case Filed Against Epstein
events.description: The U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York brought a criminal case against Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: FOIA Request from Bloomberg News
events.description: Bloomberg News submits a FOIA request to the SDNY seeking the name of a financial institution ('Institution-1') referenced in a July 12 court filing concerning Epstein's assets.

keyFacts: A FOIA request from Bloomberg News seeks the identity of a financial institution (referred to as 'Institution-1') mentioned in a July 12, 2019 court filing in the SDNY's case against Jeffrey Epstein (19-cr-00490).
The request specifically references Document 11 from the case, pages 4-5, which discuss assets controlled by Epstein.
The U.S. Attorney's Office correspondence indicates the request is 'very likely covered by exemption' and proposes a team call to discuss it.
The document confirms the existence of sealed or confidential information regarding Epstein's financial assets held by an unnamed institution as of July 2019.
